prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. 1. Create a new coordinate system. For the Euler angles, use 0.0 for X, 0.0 for Y, and -90.0 for Z. For the translation vector, use 0.0 for X, 0.5 for Y, and 0.0 for Z. 2. Begin a new 2D sketch on the XY plane of the created coordinate system. 3. Draw a rectangle with the following vertices: - Point 1: [0.0, 0.0] - Point 2: [0.75, 0.0] - Point 3: [0.75, 0.4167] - Point 4: [0.0, 0.4167] 4. Close the loop, making sure it has four vertices as described in step 3. 5. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling factor of 0.75. 6. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D by applying the rotation angles and translation vector of the coordinate system. 7. Extrude the 2D sketch into a 3D shape with a depth of 0.5 towards the normal and 0.0 opposite the normal. This will result in a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Part 2: Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The front face is angled at 45 degrees. The dimensions are 0.5 units by 0.1667 units by 0.5 units. 1. Create a new coordinate system, same as Part 1, but with a translation vector of [0.25, 0.5, 0.0] for the X, Y, and Z values, respectively. 2. Begin a new 2D sketch on the XY plane of the created coordinate system. 3. Draw a trapezoid with the following vertices: - Point 1: [0.0, 0.4167] - Point 2: [0.1667, 0.0] - Point 3: [0.5, 0.0] - Point 4: [0.3333, 0.4167] 4. Close the loop as described in step 3. 5. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling factor of 0.5. 6. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D by applying the rotation angles and translation vector of the coordinate system. 7. Perform a cut extrusion on the 2D sketch with a depth of 0.1667 towards the normal and 0.0 opposite the normal. This will create the desired prism with a front face angled at 45 degrees. Final shape: Combining the two parts mentioned above, you will obtain a three-dimensional geometric shape with various forms, including rectangles, triangles, and curved surfaces. The length of this shape will be approximately 2 units, the width will be approximately 3 units, and the height will be approximately 4 units. Other dimensions of the composite shape, including faces and loops of individual parts, are provided in the JSON snippet above.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to `[-90.0, 0.0, -90.0]` and the translation vector to `[0.0, 0.0, 0.0]`. Create a new 2D sketch on the XY plane. Draw a polyline with the following line segments: 1. Line 1: Start point at `[0.0, 0.0]`, end point at `[0.5, 0.0]`. 2. Line 2: Start point at `[0.5, 0.0]`, end point at `[0.5, 0.625]`. 3. Line 3: Start point at `[0.5, 0.625]`, end point at `[0.375, 0.625]`. 4. Line 4: Start point at `[0.375, 0.625]`, end point at `[0.0, 0.125]`. 5. Line 5: Start point at `[0.0, 0.125]`, end point at `[0.0, 0.0]`. Close the polyline and ensure that it forms a loop. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.625. Transform the scaled sketch into 3D by setting the euler angles to the coordinate system's euler angles and the translation vector to the coordinate system's translation vector. Extrude the sketch by a depth of 0.75 units in the positive Z direction and a depth of 0 units in the negative Z direction. Part 2 Instructions Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to `[-90.0, 0.0, -90.0]`, and the translation vector to `[0.0, 0.0, 0.1225]`. Create a new 2D sketch on the XY plane. Draw a polyline with the following line segments: 1. Line 1: Start point at `[0.0, 0.0]`, end point at `[0.375, 0.5]`. 2. Line 2: Start point at `[0.375, 0.5]`, end point at `[0.0, 0.5]`. 3. Line 3: Start point at `[0.0, 0.5]`, end point at `[0.0, 0.0]`. Close the polyline and ensure that it forms a loop. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.5. Transform the scaled sketch into 3D by setting the euler angles to the coordinate system's euler angles and the translation vector to the coordinate system's translation vector. Extrude the sketch by a depth of 0.25 units in the positive Z direction and a depth of 0 units in the negative Z direction. The final shape will be a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, parallel sides, and right-angled corners. The dimensions are 2 by 3 by 4, where the length refers to the longer side, the width refers to the shorter side, and the height refers to the vertical dimension.</description>
